skill.name: stride-analysis-patterns
skill.description: Apply STRIDE methodology to systematically identify threats. Use when analyzing system security, conducting threat modeling sessions, or creating security documentation.
skill.summary: Apply STRIDE methodology to systematically identify threats. Use when analyzing system security, con...

security_audit.summary: Reviewed documentation and code examples only. No executable scripts, network calls, or file access patterns were found. Behavior matches the stated STRIDE threat modeling purpose.

content.user_title: Apply STRIDE to map threats quickly
content.value_statement: Teams struggle to find threats consistently across systems. This skill provides STRIDE prompts and templates to structure analysis and documentation.
actual_capabilities: Explain STRIDE categories with guiding questions
Provide a full threat model document template
Offer a Python STRIDE analyzer code template
Include data flow diagram analysis patterns
List practical best practices and do nots
limitations: Does not scan code or systems automatically
Requires accurate system descriptions from the user
No integration with external tools or ticketing

use_cases.title: Run structured workshops
use_cases.description: Guide a cross team STRIDE session with ready prompts and outputs.

use_cases.title: Review a new feature
use_cases.description: Identify threats for a new endpoint and propose mitigations.

use_cases.title: Document risk decisions
use_cases.description: Produce clear threat model sections for audit evidence.

prompt_templates.title: Basic STRIDE pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply STRIDE to a REST API that handles user profiles. List top threats and simple mitigations.

prompt_templates.title: DFD focused review
prompt_templates.scenario: System with external and internal zones
prompt_templates.prompt: Use STRIDE with trust boundaries for a web app, API gateway, and database. Highlight boundary crossing risks.

prompt_templates.title: Risk scoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a STRIDE list with impact and likelihood. Rank the top five risks and suggest mitigations.

prompt_templates.title: Workshop facilitation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a STRIDE questionnaire for the payment service. Include prompts for spoofing, tampering, and repudiation.

output_examples.input: Model threats for a login service using STRIDE and suggest mitigations.
output: Spoofing: credential stuffing on login; add MFA and rate limits
Tampering: JWT claim changes; validate signatures server side
Repudiation: missing audit logs; log auth events with integrity controls
Information disclosure: verbose errors; use generic messages and TLS
DoS: brute force bursts; apply throttling and lockouts

best_practices: Cover all STRIDE categories for each component
Document trust boundaries and data flows clearly
Prioritize threats by impact and likelihood

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is prompt based and works with any of those platforms.

faq.question: What size of system can it handle?
faq.answer: It scales by running STRIDE per component and summarizing top risks.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my tools?
faq.answer: No direct integration is included. You can copy results into your tools.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No, it only uses the information you provide in the prompt.

faq.question: What if results feel generic?
faq.answer: Provide architecture details, assets, and trust boundaries to improve specificity.

faq.question: How does it compare to automated scanners?
faq.answer: It is a structured reasoning aid, not a vulnerability scanner.
